content:
Hi there, sorry if this is a silly question. I am running x.py setup for the first time. I would like to contribute to libs and rustc at some stage. Are these options mutually exclusive?

Welcome to the Rust project! What do you want to do with x.py?
a) library: Contribute to the standard library
b) compiler: Contribute to the compiler itself
c) codegen: Contribute to the compiler, and also modify LLVM or codegen
d) tools: Contribute to tools which depend on the compiler, but do not modify it directly (e.g. rustdoc, clippy, miri)
e) user: Install Rust from source
Please choose one (a/b/c/d/e):
or do I need multiple clones of the rustc repo?
I'd suggest choosing compiler -- the setup script is just going to setup some basic configs
Thanks for taking the time to respond :)
You can also change this later at and point, just change the text in profile at the top of config.toml
